value.title: Power BI Service and Mobile May and June 2020 feature summary
value.excerpt: It’s time to recap all the features and announcements we made for the Power BI service and mobile for the months of May and June.

value.title: July update for Power BI On-premises data gateway now available
value.excerpt: This time around, there are a couple more changes in comparison to the usual monthly On-premises data gateway update. As always, an updated version for the Mashup Engine has been released as well.

value.title: On-premises data gateway July 2020 update is now available
value.excerpt: July 2020 release of gateways

value.title: Join us! Tuesday July 21, 2020 at 11:00 AM – 12:00 noon PDT with Gaston Cruz!
value.excerpt: Join us to walk through the latest tips and tricks when working with XMLA Endpoints in Power BI.

value.title: Microsoft releases open source Power BI component for React
value.excerpt: The new component enables the embedding of reports, dashboards, dashboard tiles, report visuals, and more in React applications. Support for both JavaScript and TypeScript is provided.

value.title: Announcing React Power BI
value.excerpt: We’re thrilled to announce the release of Power BI component for React.js. React.js is a popular open-source JavaScript library, and many of you asked for an easier integration between Power BI and React web applications.

value.title: Thank You for 5 Years!
value.excerpt: Join us to thank the Power BI Community for 5 Years of contributions and helping others.  Get a sneak peek of the event, and to find out more on our blog.

value.title: Power BI Desktop July update introduces gradient legend support, Q&A enhancements, and more
value.excerpt: Microsoft has released the feature summary for this month's Power BI Desktop update. A bunch of features relating to reporting, analytics, visualizations, and other components have been released.

value.title: Join us! Thursday July 16, 2020 at 11:00 AM – 12:00 noon PDT with Markus Ehrenmueller!
value.excerpt: Power BI Desktop has to a lot to offer with visualizing time series data, whether its using built-in features or custom visualizations, scripts written in R and in Python, this is a great session to see what these tools can do to gain insights about data.

value.title: This Excel and Power BI course bundle is 95% off: Learn to make data-driven business decisions for just $25
value.excerpt: That's regardless of whether you're interested in working at Google or a small-scale finance firm. The Data Analysis with Excel + Power BI Bundle is a great resource for learning about two of the world's most popular and powerful analytics programs ...

value.title: Announcing public preview of external tools in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Today, we are further enabling external tools to work with Power BI datasets, this time from within the Power BI Desktop authoring experience. We are excited to announce the public preview of external tool support in Power BI Desktop.

value.title: Power BI Desktop July 2020 Feature Summary
value.excerpt: We have great updates this month! These updates include several enhancements to Q&A, gradient legend support, ability to further customize slicer header text, the general availability release for both relative time filter and model view enabled for live connect, the ability to launch external tools

value.title: How Metro Bank Uses Power BI to Improve the UK Banking Experience
value.excerpt: Metro Bank, a high street bank in the UK uses Power BI to improve the banking experience. The company has over 100 reports in production and is using Power BI to continually improve.

value.title: Announcing: New contact list for Power BI apps and the option to allow contributors to update apps
value.excerpt: Two new options for Power BI apps help you support and update your apps more effectively. This blog explains how the new contact list of Power BI apps and option to let contributors update app content help you be more effective.

value.excerpt: Building a data model in Power BI is the most important task you should do properly in your Power BI solution. This session is about the most common design pattern models of Power BI; Building the Star Schema with fact table and dimension tables, understand the relationships, building common models such

value.title: New capabilities for the Power BI Snowflake connector are now generally available
value.excerpt: Enhanced capabilities to the Snowflake connector for Power BI were added a while back, including support for Azure Active Directory authentication, and more. These are now generally available.

images.title: New capabilities for the Power BI Snowflake connector are now generally available

value.title: Ideas.PowerBI.com – Azure Active Directory Single Sign On is Here!

value.title: Announcing General Availability (GA) of enhanced connectivity for Snowflake
value.excerpt: We are excited to announce the that the enhanced capabilities added recently to the Power BI Snowflake connector are now GA, including the ability to connect to Snowflake without an on-premises data gateway as well as support for Azure Active Directory (AAD) authentication and SSO in DirectQuery mode

images.title: Announcing General Availability (GA) of enhanced connectivity for Snowflake
